div.p: Welcome to DeSales!
I am Tonya Amankwatia, director of distance education and instructional technology.
In the next few minutes, I will explain how you gain access
to important academic technology tools and resources.
We hope it's apparent that DSU strives to provide a variety
of quality resources for teaching and learning.
This overview, however, focuses on a few key tools and their functions.
Web Advisor is a database that gives students online access to a wealth of vital information
such as course schedules, grades, transcripts, graduation,
financial aid and payment information.
It's also the place where you update your personal information found
in the Student Profile.
The student profile area of WebAdvisor also stores your library bar code needed
for accessing Trexler library resources online as well as your initial password needed
for logging in to our learning management system for the first time.
Make sure you sign up for our Campus alert system through WebAdvisor.
This way you have campus closures and emergency messages sent to your cell phone.
Another key tool is DSU email powered by Google.
With your DSU Gmail account, you have access to a wealth of Google Apps!
Be sure to check email regularly for DSU news.
In cyberspace, online and hybrid classes occur in a Learning Management System or LMS.
Some popular LMS examples are ANGEL, Blackboard, Moodle, and Desire2Learn.
Within the LMS, students find online tutoring resources, an orientation to online learning,
library links, and our Web collaboration tools.
Enrollment in the LMS is automatic through WebAdvisor.
At this point you might be thinking, "Dr. A this all sounds great, so when do I get access?"
You will be notified of their Web Advisor, email, and LMS account information
after you are admitted to the University.
All technology problems or account questions should be directed to the DSU Help Desk
at helpdesk@desles.edu or 610.282.1100 x4357.My final piece
of advice is to use good security measures.
Be diligent about changing your password when prompted and never share your password
with anyone, avoid suspicious files and pirated media file downloads, and never send credit card
or social security data to anyone via email.
